headline: Pennsylvania, Arizona, Alabama: the Senate primary races to watch in 2022
author: Dylan Wells
sentences: WASHINGTON – A series of consequential primary races this spring and summer will shape the Senate field before the November midterm general elections, with control of the chamber and the fate of President Joe Biden's political agenda at stake.
The Senate is currently evenly split with 50 Democratic Caucus members and 50 Republican members, with Vice President Kamala Harris’ ability to cast tie-breaking votes giving Democrats the majority.
A gain or loss of even one seat could tip control of the chamber firmly in one party's favor, giving each race added importance.
Thirty-four Senate seats are up for election in November.
